{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3427484,"name":"","username":"SoupShop","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/e8c25b/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-25T23:09:23.728Z","cooked":"

I am working on connecting a VH-109 radio, and the radio only shows up as frc-vividhosting. It requires a password (which I do not have), and it only shows up on my phone, not my laptop.

@kiettyyyy

You will have to connect via Ethernet to configure the radio for the first time.

Once you’ve connected a computer to the radio via ethernet, navigate to 10.0.1.1 in a web browser. From there you can configure the radio with your team number and a password

https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/getting-started/usage/programming-your-radio

I just did this yesterday, but was unable to connect to 10.0.1.1 for some reason, but there is fortunately a fallback that you should be able to connect to on 192.168.69.1. After getting connected and updating the firmware, I had no issues connecting to 10.0.1.1. This was a new radio purchased from WCP btw, not one from CMP.

Interesting. Yeah, the fallback IP will work too, you’ll just have to set a static IP. I’ve been recommending that only as a second option so that users don’t have to set a static IP.
